org.search.engine.tree

Interface SearchEngineTree

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SearchEngineConcurrentTree

    public interface SearchEngineTree
    Interface for tree of indexing tokens contains of letters and stored values in some nodes. API contains only needed methods for working with indexation engine. This structure inspired by the implementation of concurrent radix tree which reduce memory consumption on storing lexemes. But this structure tuned by using trove4j to reduce memory consumption by storing values in the nodes.
    See Also:
    Trove4j, Concurrent-trees, Trees comparison

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getKeys(int value)
      Get set of lexeme indexed by the certain value.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getValue(java.lang.CharSequence key)
      Get the set of unique identifiers of indexed entity by the certain lexeme.
      void putMergeOnConflict(java.lang.CharSequence key, int value)
      Method put the given lexeme to the tree with value.
      void removeByKeyAndValue(java.lang.CharSequence key, int value)
      Method removes value from tree node and if value's list size is less equal one, remove node from tree.
      void removeByValue(int value)
      Remove specific value from the all nodes in the tree.
      int size()
      Return the size of all node in the tree which contains values

    • Method Detail

      • putMergeOnConflict

        void putMergeOnConflict(java.lang.CharSequence key,
                        int value)
        Method put the given lexeme to the tree with value. But because of storing in the node list of values during conflict it adds this value to the currently exists list.
        Parameters:
        key - CharSequence contains indexing lexeme
        value - Identifier of indexed entity

      • getKeys

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getKeys(int value)
        Get set of lexeme indexed by the certain value. Dictionary of indexed document. It used for comparing old and new document during document modification to avoid redundant reindexation of already existing lexeme.
        Parameters:
        value - Identifier of indexed entity
        Returns:
        Dictionary of indexed entity

      • getValue

        java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getValue(java.lang.CharSequence key)
        Get the set of unique identifiers of indexed entity by the certain lexeme.
        Parameters:
        key - CharSequence of lexeme
        Returns:
        Identifiers of indexed entity containing this lexeme

      • removeByKeyAndValue

        void removeByKeyAndValue(java.lang.CharSequence key,
                         int value)
        Method removes value from tree node and if value's list size is less equal one, remove node from tree.
        Parameters:
        key - CharSequence of searched lexeme
        value - Identifier of indexed entity which should be removed

      • removeByValue

        void removeByValue(int value)
        Remove specific value from the all nodes in the tree. If tre contains list of size one, this node will be removed
        Parameters:
        value - Identifier of indexed entity which should be removed from all nodes

      • size

        int size()
        Return the size of all node in the tree which contains values
        Returns:
        number of nodes with value in the tree
